intro: Ardisia gardneri, commonly known as the Gardner's beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. Following the flowers, it produces bright red berries that are a striking feature of the plant. These berries are not only ornamental but also attract birds and other wildlife, contributing to its ecological value.
